intro: Helicteres microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved candlewood, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its fibrous bark. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
